;Recently, "Does your company require you to wear work clothes at work?" Hot search on Weibo.

;

;A netizen attended a class reunion. A total of ten people came. It turned out that three classmates who worked in different financial institutions were wearing almost identical work clothes. Nowadays, different units have different requirements for dress code. Some require employees to wear work clothes while others do not.

;

;This seems to be a small problem, but it is not. For example, in September, the U.S. Senate was in an uproar over whether members should wear formal attire when entering the Capitol. In the end, the U.S. Senate revised the dress code: allowing senators to wear casual attire such as hoodies and shorts. This move attracted criticism from mainstream media such as The New York Times and The Washington Post.

;

;Institutions, companies, and organizations around the world are faced with a multiple-choice question when it comes to employee attire: Should they uniformly dress? What are the considerations of whether to do it or not?

;

;;

;

;;(Visual China/Picture);

;

;Realistic Considerations of Uniform Dressing

;

;The so-called "work clothes" are actually people from the same institution or organization wearing uniform styles of clothing to identify them. identity, indicate their profession, and demonstrate their responsibilities. Generally speaking, work uniforms are uniform, rigorous, and depersonalized, and are distinguished from employees' personal attire.

;

;From a company's perspective, employees often have practical considerations when wearing uniforms. First of all, this is a need to shape the corporate image. Employees are uniformly dressed and neatly organized, which will leave an initial impression that the company is rigorous, serious, and positive; uniform work uniforms generally have the company's logo on them, which can play a role in promoting the company's image.

;

;Secondly, for those positions that face customers directly and have more communication with customers, such as the financial industry and the lawyer industry, uniform attire of employees can bring customers A professional look and feel helps to dispel customers' doubts.

;

;Furthermore, for workers, wearing uniform professional work clothes can play a role in psychological suggestion, help them enter the working state, and improve their work performance. execution ability. At the same time, wearing work uniforms can also restrain the employee's personal behavior, reminding him that his words and deeds represent not only his personal image, but also the image of the unit.

;

;There are also some special professions, and uniform dress is to reflect the authority and seriousness of the profession.

;

;For example, our country has put forward uniform dress requirements for some public authorities, including the public security department, national security department, judicial department, court system, procuratorate system, Customs system, tax system, national quality inspection department, etc.

;

;On the other hand, this time the U.S. Senate relaxed its dress requirements, which attracted criticism because public opinion was worried that this would undermine the seriousness of Congress. The New York Times wrote this: With the United States so divided right now, one of the last signs of harmony in the Senate is the dress code.

;

;While it does not erase the deep differences beneath the surface, it does remind each senator that their goal is still to pursue majority consensus.

;

;There are also uniform attire for some professions, which are determined by the characteristics of the profession.

;

;For example, doctors’ white coats were first used to promote disinfection habits in surgical operations. The blood stains on the white coats serve as reminders; in addition, clean and tidy clothes White coats can also help doctors prevent static electricity during treatment. Many medical devices are very precise instruments, and the impact of static electricity on the equipment may mislead the diagnosis and treatment results.

;

;When doctors enter the operating room, they usually wear blue or green surgical gowns, which is related to "persistence of vision". During the operation, when the doctor sees the patient's red blood and shifts his gaze to the doctor's white robe, a "complementary color afterimage" will appear.

;

;As long as the doctor looks at the complementary color of red - such as blue or green, it can immediately alleviate the effect of "complementary color afterimage" and reduce visual fatigue, so the surgery Most servers use blue-green.

;

;;

;

;;(Visual China/Picture);

;

;Relaxing the dress code is not necessarily a bad thing

;

;Some units and institutions require uniform dress for reasonable reasons, but this does not mean that uniform dress is suitable for everyone Unit does not mean that uniform dress has advantages and disadvantages.

;

;Some people who have experienced the 1970s and 1980s may be deeply impressed by the "uniform dress" everywhere in that era. At that time, there was a saying that "law enforcement must wear uniforms", and all public institutions would wear uniforms.

;

;On the one hand, it reflects the sense of honor of the profession and "style"; on the other hand, it regards work uniforms as the "hidden benefits" of the unit. Some units treat employees Clothing for all seasons is provided, but the finance department is asked to pay for it.

;

;So much so that later on, some industries and personnel that did not have administrative functions at all also wore uniforms, and they were similar to those of law enforcement departments, "a fox pretends to be a tiger," It undermines the seriousness of law enforcement agencies, wastes finances, and has a negative impact.

;

;So, starting in 1986, the State Council rectified uniform dress. In 1988, 1991, 1992, and 2003, the State Council successively issued regulations on the issue of uniform dress. The relevant notice criticized those departments that arbitrarily unified the uniform dress code, which "not only affects the seriousness of the uniform dress code, but also leads to increasing financial expenditures." Later, the State Council also made clear regulations on uniform dress departments and personnel. It can be seen that it is not good to dress uniformly.

;

;Uniform dress will bring some workers a feeling of restriction, rigidity and lack of freedom. Therefore, many employees are opposed to uniform dress. A British survey showed that 61% of people looking for a new job in 2017 said they would have a negative view of any company that enforced a dress code.

;

;In order to combat the monotonous uniform dress, Western workplaces gave birth to the employee activity Casual Friday ("casual Friday") - employees voluntarily set Friday as casual clothing On this day, at least on this day, I can control the autonomy of dressing and be free to be myself.

;

;Another study suggests that the majority of the UK workforce would feel more productive if dress codes were more relaxed.

;

;Those large companies that value creativity, such as Microsoft and Facebook, often do not impose dress code requirements for their employees. Although professionals may dress in the same way, for example, programmers love plaid shirts, and Zuckerberg wears the same casual clothes every day.

;

;Not only do these technology companies not require employees to dress, they also make great efforts to improve the working environment, making the workplace casual, relaxed and free, thus Stimulate employees' imagination and creativity.

;

;In short, it is difficult to generalize whether employees should dress uniformly. Some professions emphasize seriousness, some focus on the impression they bring to customers, some professions have special professional attributes, and some professions are more concerned about how to maximize creativity... Different demands also apply to clothing. There are different requirements.

;

;For workers, uniform attire is not that big a problem if the company provides free work uniforms.

;In June 2022, Duan Feng’s team realized the interventional brain-computer interface in the sheep brain for the first time; a year later In May 2023, led by Duan Feng's team, the Chinese People's Liberation Army General Hospital (301 Hospital) and Shanghai Xinwei Medical Technology Co., Ltd. jointly completed the world's first "non-human primate (monkey) interventional brain-machine" "Interface Test" was a success. This research was considered by many media to have overcome the shortcomings of invasive and non-invasive brain-computer interfaces and created the third new paradigm of brain-computer interfaces.

;

;Duan Feng, 46, is currently a professor, doctoral supervisor at Nankai University, and director of the Tianjin Key Laboratory of Interventional Brain-Computer and Intelligent Rehabilitation. Due to Duan Feng's outstanding achievements in the fields of brain-computer interfaces, artificial hibernation and intelligent aircraft, he was selected as Southern Weekend's 2023 Scientific and Technological Person of the Year.

;

;;

;

;On November 16, 2023, Duan Feng gave a speech at the Southern Weekend Science and Technology Innovation Conference

;

;According to the definition of the China Academy of Communications, brain-computer interface (BCI) technology is a revolutionary human-computer interaction. Its mechanism of action is to bypass peripheral nerves and muscles and directly interact with the brain. Establish a new communication and control channel with external devices, which has the effect of monitoring, replacing, improving/restoring damaged or impaired natural central nervous system output and input.

;

;This is a multidisciplinary cutting-edge technology that can not only assist in the diagnosis and treatment of some neurological diseases, partially or fully realize the compensation of certain human body functions, and is even expected to cure some mental diseases. Medical care is considered to be its most promising field.

;

;There are three main implementation methods of brain-computer interface, non-invasive, invasive and vascular intervention. The non-invasive brain-computer interface mainly refers to the collection of EEG signals in the cerebral cortex without surgery; the invasive type requires implanting electrodes deep into the brain, requiring surgeries such as craniotomy and bone drilling; the vascular interventional type mainly involves the electrode holder. Implanted into the corresponding inner wall of blood vessels to collect EEG signals.

;

;Currently, most research on brain-computer interfaces is in the basic research stage, and some clinical results have also been achieved. In June 2022, researchers at Johns Hopkins University completed the world's first human trial of a bilaterally implanted brain-computer interface. A subject who had been paralyzed for 30 years successfully controlled machinery through EEG signals, completing Deliver cakes and eat independently; in China, Shanghai Ruijin Hospital launched brain-computer interface and deep brain stimulation methods in 2020 to treat refractory depression.

;

;With the participation of star companies such as Meta and Neuralink owned by "Silicon Valley Iron Man" Elon Musk, attention on brain-computer interfaces has been unprecedentedly high in recent years, and Duan Feng will also establish it in 2023 The company is trying to transform the results of brain-computer interface.

;

;In fact, since he returned to China after studying in Japan in 2009, he has been on the road of "integration of industry, academia and research" by focusing on teaching and research on one hand and entrepreneurship on the other. For this reason, he often stumbled. "1 billion in 10 years, whether to do it or not" has become his "touchstone" to test whether investors are sincere.

;

;The following is Southern Weekend’s interview with Duan Feng:

;

;Want to build an “industry-university-research integration” platform

;

;;Southern Weekend:; ;From an academic background, you received a bachelor's and master's degree from the School of Mechanical Engineering of Tianjin University, and studied precision mechanical engineering at the University of Tokyo, Japan, and received a master's and doctoral degree. degree, and chose medical rehabilitation equipment to start a business. Is it because you have always been interested in machinery? ;

;

;;;Duan Feng:; When I took the college entrance examination in 1998, the major I wanted to study most was actually electronics. I filled out the application form and was transferred to the School of Mechanical Engineering of Tianjin University, where I majored in internal combustion engines and obtained postgraduate qualifications in my senior year. Studying in Japan is also an accidental choice. During my master's degree, my supervisor sent me to cooperate with two engine companies. At that time, the machinery industry was in recession, and one company went bankrupt. It was very embarrassing. At that time, I thought about changing careers and prepared to study abroad. It happened that the University of Tokyo in Japan not only waived the application fee, but also provided scholarships, round-trip air tickets and accommodation. The conditions were very good, so I chose precision manufacturing related to machinery among the majors they admitted. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;How did you later turn to brain-computer interface? ;

;

;;;Duan Feng:;I have studied intelligent service robots and unitized flexible production lines in Japan. My professional field has shifted from power machinery to robot control, and further Go to brain-computer interfaces. I first heard about the concept of brain-computer interface in a lecture at the University of Tokyo. I thought it was very interesting at the time, but I had limited energy and could not study it in depth. The biggest reason is that I want to copy Japan’s “industry-university-research” model in China. When I was studying in Japan, I encountered many companies that came to colleges and universities to invite students to dinner to identify talents, provide scholarships to students, and provide funds for scientific research projects to teachers to achieve the integration of "industry, academia, and research." At that time, this model was relatively common in China. Rare. After graduation, I returned to China and entered Nankai University. After completing my teaching tasks, I could delve into the fields I was interested in, and then started to build a company to industrialize the research results. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;How did you start your business at that time? ;

;

;;;Duan Feng: ;I learned about the market while teaching at the university. Specifically, it is to find companies to cooperate to develop things that are urgently needed by the market but there is still half a step in technology development. At that time, a friend introduced some assistive device products in cooperation with small medical device companies, which are types that rely on external force to move the limbs, but they are not independent movements. I hope to make devices that can be independently controlled by people to drive body movements, but I don’t want to sell products because it requires a series of issues such as device registration, quality inspection, and commercial promotion, so I anchored the technology research and development on the front end of the product. When I first returned to China, my monthly salary was only 3,800 yuan. After deducting 2,000 yuan for rent and 1,500 yuan for my children’s kindergarten tuition, I only had 300 yuan for living expenses every month. I think most entrepreneurs should have more money than me. Because I had no money, I had always pinned my hopes of raising money on finding partners or investors, so I took many detours and went through a process of company registration, cancellation, re-registration, and cancellation again. Many times it was dismantled. There was a difficult period when the east wall was repairing the west wall. At first, I considered making some small rehabilitation electrical stimulation equipment. A company talked to me about cooperation and asked me to do front-end research and development. It claimed that after the product was launched, the company would have its own sales channels. I believed it, but after finishing it, I found that this was not the case. Damn, there's nothing behind it. Some companies also asked me to invest in technology and promised equity. As a result, we advanced money, spent time, and invested a lot of energy. After the technology was formed, the "partner" ran away. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;How to solve the entrepreneurial start-up fund? ;

;

;;;Duan Feng: ;I earned it by selling technology. It is to help companies develop what they need and then sell it for money. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Experiencing these things, the impact on you is What? ;

;

;;;Duan Feng:;I am also reflecting and summarizing. Whether I am doing scientific research or doing industry, I just ask myself whether this is the case. If you really want to do what you want to do without anyone's help, then just do it. When I did not place my hopes on others and relied on my own efforts and persistence to do what I wanted to do, many people who helped me came to me on their own initiative. Some brought money, some brought resources, Others brought some new concepts and ideas, and gradually the matter became a success. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Among the people who took the initiative to find " Liar"? ;

;

;;Duan Feng: ;;When you have experienced some "stepping into pitfalls", it will be easier to evaluate people's risks. Now come and talk to me. Yes, you can tell whether it is suitable or not in just a few minutes. I will not accept investment from others casually now. When someone comes to talk to me, I usually ask a question, "1 billion in 10 years, do you want to do it?" If you don't want to, then don't waste each other's time. In my case, if it works, it works, if it doesn’t work, it doesn’t work. There is no middle ground. This 1 billion is not just a thought, it is a scientific estimate. I do vascular interventional brain-computer interface experiments. Each electrode is ground out bit by bit by hand. It takes 10 days of grinding 24 hours a day to make one. The cost of consumables, labor costs, etc. in these 10 days add up. The total cost is at least 100,000 yuan; another example is the large animal monkey used for experiments. It costs 200,000 yuan to buy a monkey and 300 yuan to raise it for a day. This cost is very high. "1 billion in 10 years" is only used to test whether investors have the patience and sincerity to accompany the product's growth. It does not mean that someone must spend 1 billion. If the other party does not have a basic understanding of how much time it will take, how much money it will cost, and the possible return on investment, and they come and say that they are familiar with people from a certain local government and have connections in a certain park, they will talk about it with boastful words, or they will start talking about equity without saying anything. , we need to do due diligence, these are not the partners we would choose. We prefer to cooperate with people who have feelings and ideals. ;

;

;No matter whether it is intrusive or non-intrusive, I am not optimistic about it

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Research on brain-computer interfaces has been very hot in recent years. What are the pros and cons of invasive and non-invasive brain-computer interfaces? ;

;

;;Duan Feng: ;;Non-invasive brain-computer interface is relatively safe because it is non-invasive. It mainly collects nerve discharge signals that converge on the surface of the scalp. Since this signal collection must pass through the skull and layers of tissue cells, and there are many interference signals in the scalp, the collected EEG signals are not very stable. The action EEG signal is okay, but over time, or when it recognizes finer movements, it won't work. Invasive brain-computer interfaces implant electrodes into the brain by opening the skull. If you want to collect a certain signal, you need to implant electrodes into the corresponding brain area. Usually, within half a year, the signals collected through the invasive brain-computer interface are more accurate, and the effect of human-computer interaction is also better, such as controlling the robotic arm to grab objects, and the degree of completion is also relatively high. But it’s hard to tell after half a year, because the electrodes are harmful to the brain, may lead to rejection and suppuration, scar tissue can easily accumulate around the electrodes, and the circuits will also generate a certain amount of heat, which can easily cause inflammation, which is harmful to the human body. The damage is also relatively large. Therefore, its sustainability is very poor, and the EEG signals collected later will become weaker, or even no signals can be collected. This is also a fatal shortcoming of invasive brain-computer interfaces. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;In September 2023, Neuralink’s invasive brain The machine interface has begun recruiting human clinical trial subjects. ;

;

;;Duan Feng: ;;The intrusive approach will cause great harm, but there are still many companies to deal with. What is a person? Are they silicon-based organisms or carbon-based organisms? What are these electrode materials? People and these materials are fundamentally incompatible. I did an invasive brain-computer interface on mice, and all the mice died. The monkeys in Musk's previous experiments also died. This direction is problematic in terms of long-term safety. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Why are you doing this "world's first African "Human primate (monkey) interventional brain-computer interface trial"? How were the animal types selected and what was the testing process? ;

;

;;Duan Feng: ;The trial; will be carried out starting in June 2022. It was originally to verify the feasibility of the interventional brain-computer interface. Although there have been some relevant reports internationally, whether they are true or false cannot be known until verification. In terms of details, such as verifying whether the sensor works and whether it can last for more than half a year in the animal's brain. For vascular interventional brain-computer interfaces, the blood vessels of animals that are too small, such as mice, are too thin for electrode wires to enter. Although the blood vessels of sheep are thinner than humans, they are relatively thick, and the price is also cheap. Basic movements can be distinguished. Come out; after the experiment is successful, we will test the monkey again, and let the monkey's active intention control the mechanical arm to grab food. Because monkeys are a species similar to humans, there will be no problem with it. Then we will feel more at ease when we do human experiments. . The overall process is rather tortuous. Finding partners and venues such as hospitals and laboratories is not a problem, because everyone knows that this is a very new research, and it will be easy to publish papers and get projects later, and it also has certain market prospects. The difficulty is that the early stage of this experiment was during the epidemic. Many engineers and students were often blocked and needed to find various ways to coordinate personnel. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;In January this year, the American Synchron company announced its The "vascular interventional" brain-computer interface clinical trial successfully allowed four paralyzed subjects to control external devices and complete operations such as texting and emailing, personal finance, and online shopping. How do you understand some media describing your research as "creating the third new paradigm of brain-computer interface"? ;

;

;;Duan Feng: ;;It is recommended not to interpret it out of context. This "pioneering" and "world's first" should be viewed together. When I conduct experiments on sheep, I actually mean to create the third new paradigm of brain-computer interface in China, because no one in China has done relevant research; the world's first case means that I am the first person in the world to conduct experiments on monkey species. People who do this type of experiment. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;After the success of this experiment, we will bring you What are the impacts? ;

;

;;Duan Feng: ;;From a mental point of view, it has no impact at all. I think it is very dull. According to our plan, this trial will soon enter the clinical stage, that is, it will be tested on humans, but it is still in the ethical review stage of the hospital. But I do get some emails from volunteers. What impressed me deeply was that there was a woman who wanted to save her husband who was lying in the ICU and hoped that her husband could participate in the clinical trial of brain-computer interface; there was also a grandson who wanted to save his grandmother, and the child wanted to be a volunteer; there was also a blind person Ask me to regain my sight... These letters are very touching, but our experimental ethics have not yet passed and we cannot recruit any subjects. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Some scholars believe that "the development of brain-computer interface We are currently in a bottleneck period, and there is an urgent need for new principles and new technologies to drive research in related fields into the next period of rapid development." What do you think? ;

;

;;Duan Feng: ;;The current research on brain-computer interface technology is indeed in a bottleneck period. There are many problems about brain-computer interface. Global problems are not unique to China. Whether it is a non-invasive or invasive track, there are too many players. If they could achieve results, they would have been done long ago. There are too many smart people and many wealthy capital parties. At present, everyone is in a state of relative stagnation. To some extent, it shows that there is a problem with this road, and I suggest you consider changing the track. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Change track? ;

;

;;Duan Feng: ;;Whether it is invasive or non-invasive, I am not optimistic about it, because I have done it, and there are many domestic companies or institutions. Did. In China, the current focus of the industry is still non-invasive. Everyone is crowded onto this track and there is a traffic jam. But I don’t follow any industry. I am currently focusing on vascular interventional brain-computer interface technology. ;

;

;I hope more people can do research in a down-to-earth manner

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Many people are currently focusing on the industrialization of brain-computer interfaces in rehabilitation medicine. Why? ;

;

;;Duan Feng: ;;There is a huge demand for patients in this field and the number of patients is also large. With some auxiliary equipment, partial or complete disablement of limbs can be achieved. Sports, so the market potential is relatively large. In addition, the technical process is not difficult, and some low-threshold products are relatively easy to make. As long as companies can raise funds and obtain corresponding certifications and licenses, they can quickly realize cash. If product prices drop further in the future, for example, a product worth 100,000 yuan becomes 20,000 yuan, then the demand will be even higher. There are two main chains in rehabilitation medicine, one is the innovation chain, and the other is the industrial chain. The industrial chain is to make high-end technologies low-end and turn them into products that are sinking. After sinking, they can be universally applicable to more people. After they are universally applicable to more people, there will be more data in scientific research, and there will be more After the data is collected, it is fed back to the innovation chain to form better technology and better products. What I am currently building is such a double-chain circulation platform. Therefore, we did not rush to make specific products, but calmed down and started working on the electrodes. After the electrode automation is completed, it can serve many products. My entrepreneurship was a relatively stupid situation, equivalent to begging for food with a golden rice bowl. The position I give myself is not to do specific, low-end, repetitive things, but to make the company a platform and a core system for brain-computer interface applications in rehabilitation medicine. This platform will also be open in the future. , allowing more people, companies, and institutions to do things together on this platform. As long as they don't fool me and want to do things down-to-earth, they are all welcome. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;The current overall ecology of China's brain-computer interface industrialization What is it like? ;

;

;;Duan Feng:;;I think the concept of brain-computer interface is overheated at this stage, and some irresponsible media use gimmicks to gain attention. Change the concept. For example, the flashing pictures are actually brain electrical signals induced by vision, which is a conditioned response. However, in media reports, it is described as controlled by "thoughts". It seems very fantasy, but it is actually very simple. As far as brain-computer interface companies are concerned, there are actually not many people who can really endure loneliness and do low-level R&D, because low-level R&D is too expensive and there is no cash return in the short term. I sincerely hope that more people in the industry are willing to do basic research in a down-to-earth manner. Today’s investors don’t blindly follow investments because they don’t have much money. Maybe because there are so many people speculating on concepts, there are not many people who really have the patience to accompany the growth of innovative companies. I am not willing to accept investment from such investors. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;In your opinion, the domestic brain-computer interface corresponds to In product development, what are the urgent problems that need to be solved? What type of talent is most in short supply? ;

;

;;Duan Feng:;;I think the ideal brain-computer interface product in the future should be realized through vascular intervention. In order to achieve this goal, it is urgently needed Solve the problem of electrode stability. After the stability is guaranteed, we can then find ways to realize automated production to reduce the cost of the product. Judging from the professional fields involved in talents, more cross-field and compound talents are needed. For example, there is overlap in at least two or more fields in materials, processing, machinery, circuits, medicine and other fields. The most important thing is that these people can calm down and do things in a down-to-earth manner. They will not go to this company where the salary is high today, or to make money in that field tomorrow. People without feelings cannot do good things. Under this premise, you must have good understanding and the ability to think independently and explore. Both are important. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;In addition to brain-computer interface, you have other research Simultaneously? ;

;

;;Duan Feng: ;;We are currently also developing intelligent aircraft that can take off vertically and artificial hibernation of rats. In the future, we hope that artificial hibernation experiments can be combined with interventional brain-computer interfaces to use special stimulation signals through electrodes in blood vessels to affect the entire brain, or to modify the brain in this way to make people hibernate. This technology can be used in the future It is used in some medical treatment fields. ;

;;;Open mic performance Sharp decline Actors are looking for other opportunities;;

;

;; In May of this year, the talk show industry went through a series of rectifications. Among all cities, Shanghai has been most affected. ;

;

;;Informed sources revealed to reporters that since the inventory operation in May , the cultural tourism department of Huangpu District, where most of Shanghai's talk show clubs are located, has strengthened supervision of performance content, and has become more rigorous in spot checks of performance videos every week. Actors must perform performances strictly in accordance with the approved content. If there is any discrepancy between the performance video and the submitted content, the performance organization will be fined 50,000-100,000 yuan. ;

;

;;This has led to two changes in Shanghai talk show performances. First, there are fewer individual performances or flagship shows for actors, because such performances require high content integrity and it is difficult for actors to delete passages; second, most clubs no longer hold "open mic" performances. ;

;

;;"Open Mic" is designed for new actors to practice as well as experienced actors A talk show where actors try out new jokes. Due to the unstable quality of the performance content, the open mic tickets in most clubs are relatively low, such as 19 yuan, 39 yuan, etc. Actors are not paid for speaking on the open mic. The main purpose is to polish the content and practice skills. ;

;

;;According to the reporter’s understanding, the registration form for most open microphones is Actors submit their manuscripts in advance to the agency for approval, and then sign up one to two days before the performance based on their actual situation. Due to factors such as actors' personal creative habits and time, the content and lineup of open mic performances are somewhat uncontrollable. It is common for actors to temporarily revise and adjust new jokes before going on stage or to be unable to go on stage due to unexpected circumstances and need to be replaced by other actors. Therefore, under the current cautious environment, most talk show clubs in Shanghai no longer hold such forms of talk show performances. ;

;

;;Shanghai open mic performances dropped sharply, resulting in no new actors on stage Chances are, veteran actors are unable to update their creative content. Some full-time actors will choose to go to open mics in other cities to try out new jokes, and Hangzhou has become their first choice. "Xie Haihan", the manager of Ersansan Talk Show Club, told reporters that four or five contracted actors in his club have chosen to develop in Hangzhou. Currently, there are at least 10 talk show clubs in Hangzhou. But this does not mean that actors can make money in Hangzhou, but that they are more "famous" in Hangzhou. "Everyone is willing to go to Hangzhou, mostly because of the open mic. It is difficult to earn performance fees because the market is not that big now, which leads to oversupply.";;;; p>;

;;

;

;;233 Talk Show Club host "Thank you Haihan" . ;

;

;;;;From increment to stock Downside and up of the market;;;

;

;;During interviews with reporters, many talk show practitioners mentioned Yes, in fact, the talk show market had been quietly declining even before the public controversy in May this year. The manager of a Shanghai talk show club told reporters that the current box office level of his club has returned to the state of 2017 and 2018. The number of weekly performances has been reduced to about 1/3 (when the performances were at its peak), and the attendance rate is almost the same. Cut in half. And this situation seems not only due to the industry earthquake half a year ago. ;

;

;;233 manager "Thank you Haihan" told reporters , in the past two years, the club's box office has not shown an upward trend, so it began to expand its business to second- and third-tier cities such as Nanjing and Fuzhou. ; Tue, 28 Nov 2023 11:25:03 +0800 在巴黎十年被抢近50次：移民导致社会治安恶化，法国社会治理失败http://www.infzm.com/contents/261430
;;2023-11-28 10:00:00;
;

;Recently, a female Internet celebrity said: After living in Paris for ten years, she was stolen, robbed, and blackmailed 47.5 Second-rate. Why use decimals? Because three of them were stolen and she took them back by herself, each time was only counted as half, which means it was actually 49 times. It's jaw-dropping.

;

;My relatives and friends in China studied and worked in Paris in the mid-1990s. After retiring, I visited Europe again and felt that France had changed a lot in the past 30 years: the urban appearance and infrastructure of Paris had not changed much, and there were still antique and cultural relics buildings that were hundreds of years old. However, the composition of residents has undergone great changes, and the social atmosphere and cultural customs are completely different from those 30 years ago. The personal experiences of relatives, friends and female internet celebrities are quite similar: with the increase in immigration, France's security has significantly deteriorated.

;

;The reason for the high immigration crime rate: France has many immigrants from Africa. Due to different religious beliefs, cultural traditions, and customs, these immigrants and their descendants have educational disadvantages that affect their social status and economic status. The status is at a lower level. The desire for a wealthy material life like Europe, but difficulty in supporting it financially, will of course lead to an increase in illegal and criminal behavior.

;

;The large influx of immigrants and illegal immigrants into France is a reverse sequelae of "colonialism". It can be said that France is being reverse colonized. From the 17th to the early 20th century, France occupied a large number of colonies in Africa and became the world's second largest colonial empire after Britain. The two world wars caused huge losses in France's population. In order to make up for the shortage of soldiers, France recruited hundreds of thousands of local young people from colonial French Africa to join the French army and fight against Germany.

;

;After the war, a large number of colonial soldiers stayed in France and became early immigrants. The French movie "Indigènes" has a vivid description. Many black soldiers asked: We fought for France, why can't we stay here? The French government and people were speechless.

;

;Through these early immigrants, their relatives and friends in Africa learned about the development and wealth of France, and a large number of subsequent immigrants and illegal immigrants continued to pour in. Official data: There are currently more than 8 million black people in France. Taking into account illegal immigrants, the actual number may reach 10 million, accounting for 15% of France's total population of 66 million.

;

;The changes in the demographic structure have greatly changed France’s traditional religious beliefs, cultural concepts, and living customs, intensified ideological conflicts, and brought about increased crime rates, social unrest, and opposition between ethnic groups and classes. Street demonstrations, vandalism, looting and burning have become commonplace for more than ten years and can be called a wonderful sight in Paris.

;

;The turbulent social environment not only affects the economic development of France, but also affects the personal and property safety of everyone living in Paris. In this chaotic environment, it is common to lose a wallet or mobile phone, and with such a high crime rate, it is impossible for the police to investigate and ordinary residents to guard against it. In desperation, they adopted the method of raising the threshold for filing a case: making serious crimes such as robbery a misdemeanor, treating misdemeanors as illegal, and simply ignoring the violations as much as possible.

;

;The United States has also learned this trick. In 2014, California passed a bill making theft of less than $1,000 a misdemeanor, which can be compensated through community service. Use this method to avoid conflicts between police and robbers and reduce conflicts between police and black people. This set of legal concepts and judicial practices gave birth to the "zero-yuan purchase" movement in Europe and the United States: large groups of people (mainly immigrants) rushed into stores, took things and ran away. Store owners were unable to stop them and the police were unwilling to intervene.

;

;In addition to security issues, there is also a seemingly unrelated change in life details: French bread.

;

;When relatives and friends stayed in France in their early years, they were deeply impressed by French dining. I particularly appreciate French bread: in France, bread is not only a diet, but also a culture. In order to make fragrant and delicious bread, French bakers are very particular about dough mixing, ingredients, fermentation and baking. They often start work early in the morning to ensure that fragrant and hot French bread comes out of the oven as the sun rises.

;

;When he visited Paris again after the COVID-19 epidemic, he was surprised to find that not only had France changed in terms of society and security, but even French bread was different from what it was 30 years ago. It was hard, tired, tasted bad, and had serious crumbs... Later I learned that many ordinary bakers are new immigrants who lack French culture and cooking traditions. For them, bread is no longer a national glory, cultural heritage, It has time-honored customs and exquisite taste in life, but it is just a job, without emotions, and it will not invest too much energy.

;

;This relative and friend who likes to travel said: Nowadays, it is in former French colonies such as Laos and Vietnam in Southeast Asia, and French bread is made slightly more authentic than in Paris. There are also stricter labor disciplines, certain requirements for employees, and traditional French bread baking techniques are followed.

;

;Correspondingly, the French have 150 days off per year (116.5 days per year in most states in the United States), and work an average of 1,490 hours per year (1,791 hours in the United States). Probably because there are too many new immigrants, grassroots jobs are done by immigrants as much as possible. The French natives with higher incomes are living more and more easily and are less and less willing to work. Bakers who once had a considerable social status I am too lazy to pursue my career.

;

;This is like: instead of carrying out new technological and productivity innovations and trying to reverse the decline, a company that is already in decline cuts working hours, increases wages, weakens performance appraisals, and abandons management... What will be the consequences? ?

;

;France's "traditional loss and cultural ebb" problem is neither limited to social security nor catering. The culture and art that the French were once so proud of, and indeed once reached the world's pinnacle level, are also facing the same crisis. The former French actor Depardieu entangled a group of French entertainers, scolded Hollywood for engaging in cultural aggression, and even burned the American flag to vent his anger.

;

;However, Hollywood did not carry out "cultural aggression" against France through force or unequal treaties, but people (including the French) no longer wanted to consume French movies, dramas, and games. The French should really think about themselves: they have problems in every aspect, including their ideas, ideologies, cultural concepts, artistic creations, international politics, economic and trade relations, social governance, and even baking bread. What is going on?

;

;The deterioration of social security caused by immigration reflects the French government’s failure in social governance. The cultural shock and ideological collision brought about by the immigration issue reflect deeper hidden dangers. The internal cause of France's social governance failure and cultural ebb is that the spiritual power of contemporary French people has dissipated, traditional values ​​have been abandoned, and national culture has been lost. The French live a lazy, leisurely and happy life, as comfortable as riding a slide, which confirms the old saying "to do good is to climb, to do evil is to fall". This state of life is worth pondering.

;

;At the same time, I also hope that everyone will think about what Elon Musk, who is still working hard in middle age, said: I don’t want to use the power of human nature to make money. Just like the interpretation of gravity in "Jupiter Ascending": Up is hard, Down is easy. Social and personal success require a high-spirited spiritual core.

;

;;•;;（ This article is only the author's personal opinion and does not represent the position of this newspaper);

; Tue, 28 Nov 2023 10:25:04 +0800 一座湖南县城“利剑出鞘”：八百公职人员进退公租房http://www.infzm.com/contents/261401
;;2023-11-28 09:00:00;
;

;;

;

;On the morning of November 14, 2023, a tenant in Runzhong Community, Lianyuan, Hunan, moved. Photo by Southern Weekend reporter Zheng Dan

;

;"National supervision makes public rental housing more 'sunshine'." A banner hangs on the main entrance of Runzhong Community, November 2023 Since then, there has been a sudden increase in the number of residents moving out of the community, and pickup trucks carrying furniture have been coming and going.

;

;Moving is a common thing, but recently it has become a hot topic in Lianyuan, a county-level city in Loudi, Hunan. This stems from a centralized rectification campaign to crack down on illegal occupation of public rental housing by public officials. In addition to Runzhong Community, the phenomenon of large-scale relocation has also appeared in Runzeyuan Community, Huimin Community, and Runyuan Community. According to locals, these four communities are public rental housing communities in Lianyuan City, and those who have moved are basically Lianyuan’s public officials and their relatives.

;

;A statistical table obtained by Southern Weekend reporters shows that 878 households of public employees are living in the above four public rental housing communities, plus 4 households living in public housing units. There are a total of 882 households of public servants, including 28 households with public servants at the rank of full-time clerk and above.

;

;Many Lianyuan public officials said that those on this list will be vacated before the end of November. "This is also the first time in decades that such a large area of ​​residents has been evicted." A staff member of the Lianyuan City Housing Security Service Center (hereinafter referred to as the Housing Security Center) told Southern Weekend reporters that this action is in line with the Hunan Provincial Inspection Team Request for rectification.

;

;"Don't replace the current rules and regulations with past practices, and you must not compete with the people for benefits." On October 20, the Secretary of the Lianyuan Municipal Party Committee held a meeting to schedule Public rental housing operation management and service work. "Lianyuan Online" public account announced that the meeting emphasized that public rental housing is affordable housing, and all relevant departments must unify their thinking; a leading group and a special work class must be established to conduct in-depth research, analysis, and identification of existing problems, loopholes, and weaknesses. , establish a list of ledgers by category, and increase rectification efforts.

;

;;

;

;November 2023, Lianyuan, Hunan, the main entrance of Runzhong Community. Photo by Southern Weekend reporter Zheng Dan

;

;“With such a large-scale eviction, how can the housing insurance center have the ability?”

;

;In mid-November, Southern Over the weekend, reporters visited Runzhong Community and Runzeyuan Community, where many public officials live. Red banners were hung on many fences and walls to crack down on illegal use and subletting of public rental housing. In the two communities, there are announcements from the Lianyuan City Housing Insurance Center on the front and back of each building: "The municipal party committee and the city government are cleaning up and rectifying the illegal use of public rental housing. Relevant units, organizations and individuals are welcome to report illegal rentals to our center. Once the situation of public rental housing (including the actual occupancy situation by lending, subletting, reselling and other methods) is verified, the unit, organization and individual who reported it will be rewarded 500 yuan/time." The announcement date is October 31.

;

;"There have been fewer people moving in the past two days. Many people have moved away a few days ago." On the afternoon of November 13, a resident of Runzhong Community told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;;;Public rental housing, the full name of public rental housing, refers to limited construction standards and rent levels. Affordable housing for rent for urban lower-middle-income families with housing difficulties, newly-employed workers without housing, and migrant workers with stable employment in cities who meet the prescribed conditions. According to the "Measures for the Administration of Public Rental Housing" issued by the Ministry of Housing and Urban-Rural Development in 2012, the lease period of public rental housing generally does not exceed 5 years. After the expiration of the period, if the conditions for renewal of the lease are not met, the rental period must be vacated.

;

;The origin of the concentrated evacuation of Lianyuan City, according to many public officials, was the arrival of the 11th Inspection Team of the Hunan Provincial Party Committee to work in Lianyuan City 2 During the month (September 7, 2023 - November 7, 2023), some people reported that public officials illegally occupied public rental housing and sublet and resold it, resulting in poor households who really needed a house without a house to live in.

; The Notice also mentioned that the 11th Inspection Team of the Hunan Provincial Party Committee issued a handover letter to Lianyuan City on October 17, 2023, reporting that there was a problem in public rental housing in Lianyuan City that public officials competed with the people for profit.

;

;This notice requires each unit to carefully conduct an investigation into the public rental housing situation of the unit's staff (including family members), and on October 23, 2023 Submit the "Statistical Form of Public Rental Housing Rented by Public Employees" to the Municipal Housing Insurance Center before 17:00.

;

;"Many people brought this matter to the inspection team to report it. The inspection team felt that this was a common problem. According to an investigation, eight to nine hundred households had public officials (residing in public houses). Rent a house)." Lin Min (pseudonym), a staff member of the housing insurance center, told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;The phenomenon of public officials illegally occupying public rental housing is not an isolated case. Public information shows that in May 2021, an inspection by the Discipline Inspection and Supervision Committee of Qingchuan County, Guangyuan City, Sichuan Province found that local public officials used 412 public housing units in violation of regulations, including 275 public rental housing units in violation of regulations, involving 145 public officials.

;

;Further forward, in 2019, the Discipline Inspection and Supervision Committee of Anhua County, Yiyang City, Hunan Province also discovered such a phenomenon. 4 public employees sub-leased public rental housing, 5 public employees sub-leased public rental housing, and 28 public officials did not meet the conditions for renting and did not withdraw in time.

;

;According to public information from the Lianyuan City Media Center, on the evening of October 25, 2023, members of the 11th Inspection Team of the Hunan Provincial Party Committee met at the Lianyuan Municipal Party Committee Standing Committee It was once again emphasized at the meeting that we must confront the issue of public rental housing, which is a matter of strong public response and concern, and push forward the rectification of the problem steadily and solidly.

;

;In fact, before the arrival of the inspection team, Lianyuan City also tried to rectify this problem. According to a report by Hunan Daily in early 2023, the Lianyuan City Housing Insurance Center carried out a special clean-up and rectification operation for illegal use of public rental housing by public officials from January 9 to 18.

;

;"In January, more than ten households with serious non-compliance of public officials were reported, including those with cars and houses under their names. Then again Some people were replaced, and a few households were finally cleared." Lin Min said that according to Lianyuan City's practice, such special clean-ups are organized every two or three years, but the intensity of the clean-ups is relatively small.

;

;"How can our housing insurance center have the ability to move out with such great efforts now? If the inspection team hadn't come and the municipal Party committee secretary personally arranged the move, who would have moved? "According to Lin Min, the rectification of public rental housing involves many cadres, and it is difficult for the municipal housing insurance center to implement it.

;

;;

;

;On the afternoon of November 13, 2023, a Public employees moved out of Runzhong Community. Photo by Southern Weekend reporter Zheng Dan

;

;Too many vacancies, is it a waste?

;

;Are public employees eligible to live in public rental housing? Nie Chen, an associate professor at the School of Public Administration at Beihang University who has long studied housing security, believes that it is normal for some qualified public officials with lower incomes and housing difficulties to live in public rental housing.

;

;"After the abolition of the welfare housing allocation system in 1998, most provinces and cities across the country no longer ;have units built; to provide housing to employees. It is true that some civil servants have low wages, heavy family burdens, and cannot afford a house, so they meet the conditions for applying for public rental housing." said Wang Cailiang, director of the China Construction Management and Real Estate Law Research Center.

;

;But regarding the situation in Lianyuan, a person familiar with the situation told Southern Weekend reporters that most of the public employees who moved into public rental housing were moved in through lottery, and a small number of them moved in through " "Apply the note" to get the accommodation. "Some people buy houses in Loudi, but they don't have houses in Lianyuan; some people have houses in Lianyuan, but they want this house; and some are helping friends or relatives to approve notes."

;

;"The hardest-hit area is Runzhong Community, where most public officials are located. It is close to the city center and has a more convenient location." The person familiar with the matter said. Southern Weekend reporters compared the public rental list of Runzhong Community’s three computer lottery results with the public rental housing statistics table for public rental housing rented by public officials in Lianyuan City. They found that a total of 1,826 households were occupied in Runzhong Community’s three lottery draws. There were 669 public servants in the community, accounting for 10% of the community’s residents. The total number is about 37%; 522 of them are on the lottery results announcement list, and the remaining 147 households are not on the lottery list.

;

;Southern Weekend reporter also obtained a copy of Lianyuan City's "Statistical Table of Housing Check-out of Public Rental Housing for Leading Cadres of Zhengke and above", which shows that many units have 28 cadres at the department level have checked out at the end of October 2023, and the furniture is still being cleaned.

;

;Why are there such a large number of public officials living in Runzhong Community? The above-mentioned insider revealed that after the completion of Runzhong Community, during the public lottery in 2017 and 2018, due to some special reasons, "as long as you participate in the lottery, you can get a house."

;

;"Runzhong Community built more than 2,300 houses at one time, but no one lives in them, but it requires an occupancy rate of 90%. If the housing insurance center cannot complete it, it will Being criticized. Because you have to build so many houses, it must mean that there is such a huge demand." The person familiar with the matter said that when allocating rents, the housing security department reported the low occupancy rate to the Lianyuan Municipal Government, and then the Lianyuan Municipal Government A meeting was held to discuss relaxing the conditions, and public officials who do not have housing in Lianyuan can apply for the lottery.

;

;On November 24, 2023, a reporter from Southern Weekend called the relevant person in charge of the Lianyuan City Housing Insurance Center to verify this statement. The other party said that it was "not needed". declined to be interviewed.

;

;Another staff member of the Lianyuan City Housing Insurance Center told Southern Weekend reporters that Runzhong Community is located in Jianzhong Village and Hujia Village, Lantian Street, and construction started at the end of 2012. Construction, including low-rent housing and public rental housing, was called the "Under Construction Low-rent Housing and Chengdong Public Rental Housing Project" at the time.

;

;Information from the official website of the Lianyuan Municipal Government in 2013 shows that the Jianzhong low-rent housing and Chengdong public rental housing projects are Lianyuan City’s “Twelfth Five-Year Plan” housing security One of the key affordable housing construction projects implemented within the plan. The project covers an area of ​​188 acres, with a total planned construction area of ​​140,000 square meters, a total investment of 180 million yuan, and a total of 2,076 housing units planned to be built. After completion, it will become the largest housing area, the most complete functions, and the most livable environment in Lianyuan City. A good residential community.

;

;A property bidding document for Runzhong Community in 2021 mentioned that the total construction area of ​​the housing in the community is 140,000 square meters, with a total of 30 buildings, including 2,218 residential units. 742 non-residential (service buildings).

;

;;

;

;The panorama of low-rent housing in Jianzhong (top) released by the "Lianyuan Online" public account, and the panorama of Runzhong Community published in "Lianyuan Yearbook (2019)" (bottom). Information map

;

;Low-rent housing refers to the government providing social housing to families who meet the low living security standards for urban residents and have housing difficulties in the form of rent subsidies or in-kind rent allocation. Social housing. Nie Chen told Southern Weekend reporters, "In a sense, low-rent housing is public rental housing. It caters to people with lower incomes, and the rent is lower than public rental housing. In 2014, low-rent housing and public rental housing were merged, and now they are basically Called public rental housing."

;

;Nie Chen analyzed that from 2010 to 2015, the country promoted public rental housing and low-rent housing on a large scale. At that time, it set a goal: to solve 1540 problems by the end of 2012. To solve the housing problem of 10,000 low-income families with housing difficulties, the coverage of affordable housing should reach 20% in 2015. "At that time, various places had goals to achieve and built a large number of public rental housing." However, during the actual investigation, Nie ;Chen; found that some areas, including Beijing, Shanghai, and Baotou, Inner Mongolia, had a shortage of public rental housing. Due to remoteness or other factors, fewer people apply for rentals, resulting in vacant public rental housing.

;

;"There is a trend now that the conditions for public rental housing are gradually relaxing, and there is even a phenomenon of converting into affordable rental housing, expanding the scope of security." Nie ;Chen; said that the rent of affordable housing is generally not higher than 90% of the rent of market rental housing of the same quality in the same location. "But it cannot be directly converted into commercial housing because the government has strict control over public rental housing." ";. ;

;

;It is worth noting that in October 2020, the Lianyuan City Discipline Inspection Committee and the Lianyuan City Supervisory Committee notified the Jianzhong Integrity Committee Collusive bidding issues in rental housing construction. In November 2012, Liang Mou, the former deputy director of the Anti-Corruption and Bribery Bureau of the Lianyuan City People's Procuratorate, and Zhang Mouxian (an active participant in a gangland organization headed by Tan Mouping) worked to obtain low-rent housing and urban housing in Jianzhong, Lianyuan City. For the construction project of the 14th bidding section of the Donggong Rental Community, four companies including Hunan Lianyuan Xiangzhong Engineering Company were contacted to collude in bidding, and finally won the project. The relevant judgment shows that Liang and Zhang Xian made illegal gains of more than 1.29 million yuan from the project. In August 2020, Liang was expelled from the party and dismissed from public office.

;

;In addition to Runzhong Community, there are also many public officials in Huimin Community and Runzeyuan Community. A public official in Huimin Community said that Huimin Community has gradually relaxed conditions for public officials because there are too many vacant houses. Many public officials also said that the application conditions for public rental housing complexes in Lianyuan were previously loose, and migrant workers who did not have a house in Lianyuan could participate in the lottery.

;

;"The salary of public employees is not high, and many of them meet the conditions (lottery)." Lu Ke (pseudonym), a deputy section-level public employee who lives in public rental housing ) said that the permanent urban population of Lianyuan City is less than 300,000, and it is difficult for poor households who have paid social security and do not have a house to live in public rental housing. "We should take care of the low-income population first. If there are still vacancies, the conditions must be relaxed, otherwise it will be a waste of public resources."

;

;Wang Cailiang believes that the lottery, The two check-in methods of approval note treat the Lianyuan case separately. "Public rental housing is affordable housing developed from the past affordable housing. It mainly solves the problem of a large number of working-class people with low incomes who cannot afford market-oriented housing. If such behavior as granting notes still exists, it is an abuse of power. .” For those who meet the application conditions and move in through lottery, temporary withdrawal may be suspected of breach of contract.

;

;;

;

;November 2023, In Lianyuan, Hunan, banners are posted in Runzeyuan Community to crack down on illegal use of public rental housing. Photo by Southern Weekend reporter Zheng Dan

;

;“Patching” and “one size fits all”

;

;On November 1, 2023, "Lianyuan City Public Security Bureau" New regulations were released, proposing more detailed requirements. Nie Chen told Southern Weekend reporters that regulations for the management of public rental housing are generally formulated by local governments based on local economic conditions. However, the state has unified regulations that tenants must meet two conditions: "low income" and "poor housing".

;

;Lianyuan's new rules and regulations show: Lianyuan City's urban subsistence allowance, low-income, and lower-middle-income families with housing difficulties, newly employed workers without housing and those in urban areas Migrant workers with stable employment who meet local public rental housing admission conditions should be included in the scope of public rental housing security.

;

;Among them, lower-middle-income urban households with housing difficulties refer to households whose per capita annual disposable income is lower than the per capita disposable income of urban residents in the previous year and whose household savings are low. Households with housing difficulties of 180,000 yuan (including provident fund) and no real estate in cities at the county level and above; newly employed workers without housing refer to workers who have been working for less than 5 years and are employed locally and whose families have no local housing.

;

;Lin Min analyzed that the limit on per capita annual disposable income of a family and the limit on working less than 5 years are enough to exclude most public officials.

;

;"More than 20 public employees who have served less than five years have not been given notice of retirement, and the rest are all the same." Lin Min recalled that the housing security center held an internal meeting According to the requirements of the government, all public employees who have worked for five years will be dismissed. "It is communicated to the top and bottom that all of them should quit first, and those who meet other conditions for moving into public rental housing can then apply for the next round of lottery."

;

;Lu Ke also told Southern Weekend reporters that except for a few college graduates who had worked less than 5 years, all the public employees who lived in public rental housing in his unit were vacated. .

;

;A grassroots enterprise staff member who was asked to vacate a public rental house because he had worked for more than 5 years wrote in the mailbox on the official website of the Lianyuan Municipal Government: " (I) originally had no relatives or real estate in Lianyuan. I am a low-income person who fully meets the conditions. I cannot compete with the people for benefits. I sincerely ask the leaders to consider people from other places as appropriate and not to apply one-size-fits-all. Grassroots workers are also people."

;

;Before the new regulations were introduced, were public officials really not competing with the people for benefits by staying in public rental housing? Southern Weekend reporters randomly interviewed two households in Runzhong Community, both of which were non-public servant families. At that time, they applied for public rental housing through regular lottery channels. One of them said that his brother and mother also applied for public rental housing in this way, and had never been unable to apply for public rental housing before.

;

;Lin Min believes that later people reported that there was no public rental housing to apply for, which was a new problem in the new stage. "Some people did not need public rental housing at the time, but later their children got married and needed houses again, and some ;had family changes." In addition, in recent years, Lianyuan has no longer New public rental housing. Due to national policy adjustments, in principle, no new public rental housing will be built after 2016.

;

;On November 8, 2023, the Lianyuan City Housing Insurance Center issued an announcement to accept applications for public rental housing waitlists from that day to November 20. Those who meet the new regulations can apply for public rental housing.

;

;;

;

;On the afternoon of November 13, 2023, a Public employees moved out of Runzhong Community. Photo by Southern Weekend reporter Zheng Dan

;

;According to multiple public officials, on Thursday, November 9, 2023, when the inspection team was about to leave Lianyuan, the urban management A public employee of the bureau who was about to retire organized several people to go to the office of the inspection team to express their demands.

;

;"The person who took the lead did some renovations (in the vacated public rental housing) to see if (the government) could compensate some money." One person Officials from the Urban Management Bureau said that dozens of people were sought, involving multiple units.

;

;A public official who stayed at Runzeyuan told Southern Weekend reporters that his family also followed him to report the situation. "Originally, the first notice was given to move before December 10th, but after they went (to report the situation), they issued a notice the next day that they must move before November 30th."

;

;A public official from the Lianyuan Municipal Development and Reform Commission recalled that on the morning of Friday (November 10), the unit organized a meeting and required them to sign a commitment letter and must move out of the public rental housing before November 30. Another public official who is engaged in teaching also said that the school held an emergency meeting that morning. "The leader asked us to sign a commitment letter. If we don't move by the end of the month, we will fail the annual assessment and we will not get any performance pay."

;

;"Our unit has more intensive meetings, and they are held on Saturdays and Sundays." The aforementioned public official from the Urban Management Bureau said that there are 10 or 20 people from the Urban Management Bureau. Reflecting on the demands, "Most of the houses in our unit have been renovated, and there are quite a lot of complaints."

;

;As far as Lin Min knows, among the public employees who live in public rental housing, those who spend the most on decoration spend more than 200,000 yuan. Regarding whether compensation will be provided for decoration, Lin Min said that the public rental housing contract clearly stipulates that "repair and throw away" will not be compensated for decoration. "Because it is not a rough house. The bathroom, kitchen, and lighting fixtures are all installed. Once it meets the delivery standards, you can basically move in. This is a national subsidy to poor households. Your decoration is somewhat contrary to the government's rental."

;

;In addition, many interviewees told Southern Weekend reporters that the resale of public rental housing in Lianyuan City is relatively common. "I heard that a house of more than 50 square meters can be sold for as high as 50,000 to 60,000 yuan." Lin Min said that the reason why many people renovate public rental housing and resell it may be due to a deep-rooted local concept. To. “We in Lianyuan have a thought that if the government gave me this house, it means that this house is mine. I never worried that I would not be able to live in this house. I didn’t expect that the inspection team came and asked us to move. ”

;

;Following this, rents in some Lianyuan areas close to public rental housing have also increased. "The rent for a two-bedroom house on Xingfu Road used to be less than 4,000 yuan a year, but now it has increased to 5,000 yuan." A public official who lives in Runzhong Community told Southern Weekend reporters that according to public rental housing The price is just over 2,000 yuan a year. Two other public officials who were dismissed also confirmed: "Suddenly more than 800 households moved out, and the supply of (nearby rental housing) must be tight."

;

;On November 14, a Southern Weekend reporter consulted a staff member of the housing insurance center as a "tenant unwilling to check out." The other party said that if they think they meet the conditions for living in public rental housing, they can submit materials and request re-examination. The application deadline was 12 noon that day, and eighty or ninety households who were unwilling to check out had already submitted materials.

;

;A public official who submitted materials said that he received a notice on November 18 and still had to vacate. As far as he knows, only one public official who is paralyzed and has family difficulties has passed the review and can continue to rent public rental housing.

; Tue, 28 Nov 2023 09:25:03 +0800 支原体肺炎是新冠的变异？张文宏等专家解读误区http://www.infzm.com/contents/261440
;;2023-11-28 08:00:00;
;

;Currently, as winter begins in various places, respiratory diseases have entered a period of high incidence. How should we prevent and treat it? What are the misunderstandings about respiratory diseases?

;

;The "Healthy China" column of the main station invited Professor Zhang Wenhong of Huashan Hospital Affiliated to Fudan University, Liu Qingquan, President of Beijing Hospital of Traditional Chinese Medicine Affiliated to Capital Medical University, and Vice President of Beijing Chaoyang Hospital Affiliated to Capital Medical University. Three experts, including Tong Zhaohui, director of the Institute of Respiratory Diseases, explained in detail the common misunderstandings about respiratory diseases on the Internet.

;

;Myth 1: Respiratory viruses are complicated this winter, and superinfection is scary?

;

;Zhang Wenhong said that many people are afraid of superinfection. In fact, sometimes multiple viruses or bacteria are detected because very sensitive detection methods are used, so don’t worry too much.

;

;Tong Zhaohui said that although many pathogens have been detected, it does not mean that every one is pathogenic. The doctor will comprehensively analyze which bacteria are the patient's pathogenic bacteria based on the patient's clinical condition.

;

;Liu Qingquan said that from the perspective of traditional Chinese medicine, superinfection is a combined disease or comorbidity. "For example, after having a fever for 7 days, it was discovered that it was influenza. About 10 days later, the fever returned, and this time it was mycoplasma. This is actually not a superposition, but a situation of poor maintenance and subsequent illness."

;

;Myth 2 : Mycoplasma pneumonia is a mutation of the new coronavirus?

;

;Tong Zhaohui said that humans discovered mycoplasma as a microorganism at the beginning of the 20th century, and it was not determined to be a pathogen until the end of the 20th century. The new coronavirus was only known to everyone at the end of 2019, and there is no difference between the two. It doesn't matter.

;

;Why are children particularly susceptible to mycoplasma infection? Tong Zhaohui said that children's immune systems are not fully developed and their resistance is not as good as adults', so they are more susceptible to infection.

;

;Myth 3: Once you have a cold or fever, you need to get an infusion quickly?

;

;Tong Zhaohui said, "Infusions will heal a cold and fever quickly." This is actually a misunderstanding.

;

;Compared with influenza, colds and fevers have lower temperatures and milder symptoms, and are often upper respiratory tract symptoms. If you have a fever or cough after catching a cold, just take fever-reducing or cough-relieving medicine at home. Pay attention to getting more rest, drinking more water, and supplementing your nutrition.

;

;As for influenza, some influenza may cause pneumonia or even severe pneumonia. At this time, you may need to be hospitalized, and the resident doctor will determine whether you need infusion.

;

;Zhang Wenhong also said that infusion is generally limited to hospitalized critically ill patients, or some drugs cannot be taken orally and can only be administered through infusion. For the common cold, oral medications work better.

;

;Myth 4: Mycoplasma pneumonia can be cured at home?

;

;Tong Zhaohui said that in most cases, whether it is a virus or mycoplasma, if it is limited to the upper respiratory tract, most of it can heal on its own, and a small number may develop pneumonia.

;

;Zhang Wenhong said that generally speaking, mycoplasma pneumonia can be improved by taking some symptomatic drugs at home, but it is necessary to pay attention to whether it develops into a serious condition. For example, if your child's condition improves after taking medicine, you can observe it at home; if your child still has a high fever after taking antipyretics and is sluggish and unwilling to eat, you should seek medical attention as soon as possible.

;

;Myth 5: Increased exercise and sweating in winter can improve immunity?

;

;Liu Qingquan said that from the perspective of traditional Chinese medicine, excessive sweating will damage a person’s yang energy. During winter sports, your body will feel slightly warm and you may sweat a little. It's okay to work up a sweat, but it doesn't have to be every day.

;

;Zhang Wenhong said that everyone is encouraged to maintain a certain level of exercise. "Even if you are very busy today, it is good to walk 5,000 steps."

;

;Special reminder: Please pay attention to the weather conditions in winter and wear a mask as appropriate.

In July 2023, ;Pangu meteorological model developed by Huawei Cloud;, in the medium and long-term global weather forecast surpass traditional numerical prediction methods.

;

;More importantly, the MLWP model can also be extended to other geographical spatiotemporal predictions such as ecology, energy, and animal activities.

;

;On November 20, "Nature Medicine" published a paper on the research results of Alibaba Damo Academy and more than ten medical institutions around the world;Large-scale pancreatic cancer detection via non-contrast CT and deep learning;, for the first time it has been proven that "plain scan CT + AI" technology can effectively detect early stage pancreatic cancer on a large scale Pancreatic cancer.

;

;Pancreatic cancer is a digestive tract tumor with a very poor prognosis. It has the characteristics of difficulty in early diagnosis, low surgical resection rate, and easy recurrence and metastasis after surgery. It is also known as the "King of Cancers" because of its early diagnosis. Symptoms are vague, lack specificity, and are easily overlooked. CT is the most widely used and most sensitive examination method for detecting pancreatic cancer. However, the contrast of plain CT images commonly used in physical examinations and hospitals is low, making it difficult to identify early pancreatic lesions.

;

;The research team built a deep learning framework—Pancreatic cancer early detection model PANDA (Pancreatic cancer Detection with AI), which uses AI to amplify and identify subtle pathological features that are difficult to detect with the naked eye in plain CT images; internal Test evaluation shows that PANDA can achieve 90% pancreatic cancer lesion sensitivity and 99.9% lesion specificity in more than 20,000 clinical cases.

;Using AI to accelerate the popularization of early cancer screening, early detection and early treatment, the quality of patients’ lives can be guaranteed to the greatest extent.

;
